scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended – PAYG DB
scenarios.description: Two-tier web app with App Service and Azure SQL Database Business Critical 4 vCores on pay-as-you-go, including basic networking, security, monitoring and backup.

resources.notes: Single production VNet for App Service integration and private endpoints to Azure SQL Database. No direct VNet cost but needed for topology.
Premium v3 P1v3 App Service Plan (1 instance) hosting the web tier. Assumes Linux runtime, 2 vCores, 8 GB RAM. 50 GB included storage. Estimated 300 GB/month outbound traffic from app to internet.
resources.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v2 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan
Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan

resources.notes: Single Azure SQL Database, Business Critical tier, Gen5, 4 vCores as requested. Pay-as-you-go pricing. Assumes 512 GB allocated storage and zone-redundant HA within region. 50 GB/month outbound data (e.g. backups, exports, admin access).

sku_candidates.product_name: SQL Database Elastic Pool - Premium RS

resources.notes: Represents underlying blob storage consumption for SQL automated backups and long-term retention. Approximation: 300 GB total (200 GB hot, 100 GB cool) with GRS redundancy and moderate operations.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration, Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration

sku_candidates.meter_name: Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration
sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

resources.notes: Application Gateway v2 with WAF for HTTP(S) termination and protection in front of App Service. Estimated 300 GB/month outbound and 100M HTTP(S) requests.
Standard public IP for Application Gateway exposure to internet clients.
NAT Gateway for outbound internet access from integrated services (e.g., App Service VNet integration). Estimated 100 GB/month outbound via NAT.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Azure Key Vault Standard for connection strings, secrets, and certificates used by App Service and automation. Approx. 50k operations/month.
Standard C1 Redis cache for session state and application caching to offload Azure SQL. 1 GB cache, moderate throughput and operations.
Central Log Analytics workspace for App Service, SQL diagnostics, and platform logs. Approx. 200 GB/month ingestion, 100 GB archived.
Recovery Services vault for backing up App Service content (via connected storage), configuration exports, and any supporting VMs if added later. 250 GB protected backup data assumed.
resources.meter_name: ADLS Gen2 Vaulted LRS Write Operations

ADLS Gen2 Vaulted ZRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted RA-GRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted GRS Write Operations

resources.notes: Placeholder for DR protection of any stateful components (e.g., future VMs or storage). Azure SQL DB uses built-in geo-replication; ASR here is minimal (1 protected instance) to model DR capability.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized – 1-year reserved DB
scenarios.description: Same two-tier architecture but with Azure SQL Database Business Critical 4 vCores on 1-year reserved capacity to reduce database costs; slightly reduced supporting resources.

resources.notes: Same VNet topology as baseline; no direct cost but kept for completeness.
Same SKU (P1v3) but assumes some off-hours scaling down or use of deployment slots to reduce effective runtime to ~600 hours/month.

resources.notes: Azure SQL Database Business Critical, Gen5, 4 vCores with 1-year reserved capacity. Same performance as baseline but lower unit price. 512 GB storage assumed.

resources.notes: Application Gateway WAF v2 with slightly reduced active hours (e.g., scaled down during off-peak) to save cost.
Standard public IP for Application Gateway; always allocated.
NAT Gateway with reduced active hours and slightly lower outbound volume to reflect cost optimization.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Same Key Vault but with fewer operations assumed to reflect optimized usage and caching of secrets.
Basic B1 Redis cache (non-HA) to reduce cost while still providing some caching. 600 active hours/month assumed.
Reduced ingestion (120 GB/month) and use of archive/capped retention to lower monitoring costs.
Backup vault with slightly lower protected data volume and fewer restore operations to reflect cost optimization.

resources.notes: Minimal DR footprint (1 protected instance) with lower replicated storage to keep DR costs down. Azure SQL DB still relies on built-in geo-replication if enabled.
